de.esoco.lib.collection

Class ObservableSet<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<T>
      • de.esoco.lib.collection.AbstractObservableCollection<E,java.util.Set<E>,CollectionEvent<E,java.util.Set<E>>>
        • de.esoco.lib.collection.ObservableSet<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.event.EventSource<CollectionEvent<E,java.util.Set<E>>>, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<E>, java.util.Collection<E>, java.util.Set<E>

    public class ObservableSet<E>
extends AbstractObservableCollection<E,java.util.Set<E>,CollectionEvent<E,java.util.Set<E>>>
implements java.util.Set<E>, java.io.Serializable
    A set implementation that can be used to observe arbitrary set instances for changes.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ObservableSet()
      Creates a new instance that is backed by a HashSet instance.
      ObservableSet(java.util.Set<E> rObservedSet)
      Creates a new instance that observes a certain set instance for changes.

    • Method Detail

      • createEvent

        protected CollectionEvent<E,java.util.Set<E>> createEvent(de.esoco.lib.event.ElementEvent.EventType rType,
                                                          E rElement,
                                                          E rUpdateValue,
                                                          int nIndex)
        Must be implemented by subclasses to create a new event object. This method will only be invoked if listeners have been registered on this observable collection instance, so implementations need not test this. See the method AbstractObservableCollection.notifyListeners(ElementEvent.EventType, Object, Object, int) for more details.
        Specified by:
        createEvent in class AbstractObservableCollection<E,java.util.Set<E>,CollectionEvent<E,java.util.Set<E>>>
        Parameters:
        rType - The type of event
        rElement - The element affected by the event
        rUpdateValue - The new element value in case of an update event
        nIndex - The position index for random access collections
        Returns:
        A new event object
